reviews.review: Ricochet is honestly, by far, the absolute best game ever made. I've played many timeless classics, such as Witcher 3, Fallout: New Vegas, Dark Souls, and Half-Life, but I must say, this is my favorite game of all time. The controls are an absolute joy to use, especially with how smooth they are, the gameplay, involving you throwing some beautifully colored disks at other players or decapitating them during an intense battle on the most beautiful and colorful arena I've ever seen, is top-notch, and the story and lore are enthralling. You can just tell the developers spent AT LEAST 25 minutes making this game. The graphics are definitely the most beautiful graphics ever seen, with the jaw-dropping neon color pallet that perfectly suits its environment. I rate this game a perfect 10/10 for its gameplay, story, and graphics. Valve, Please. Take your focus off of Dota 2 and make a sequel to this brilliant masterpiece.

Ricochet. What else can you say to describe this ∞+1000000/10 masterpeice of a game. No other game [b]IN THE WORLD[/b] compares to the perfection that is this game. In fact, no, it's not a game, it's an [b][u]experience[/u][/b]. Calling it a "game" is an insult to Ricochet as it's like comparing it to lesser titles. There just can't be a Ricochet 2 because Valve knows it'll never be as good as the first Ricochet in a million [b]LIFETIMES[/b] and that it would be spitting in Ricochet's face. If you've never heard of Ricochet or even have the audacity to think this masterpiece is [i]bad[/i], then you might as well be blind or deaf or both, because Ricochet isn't just a lesser known Valve game, it was a literal gift from the gods that was rediscovered in the blessed year of 2000. It was found in an underground temple in Death Valley, California. They found hieroglyphics showing that before the settlers came to America, an unknown tribe of Indians praised Ricochet as a god, but looking deeper into the temple also showed that Ricochet is a divine being who has existed before creation itself! And in an unknown time, the romans nailed Ricochet to a cross, he died for your sins! but then Ricochet came back 3 days later and basically killed all of the romans that he didn't like and decied to vacation at what is now America but one day mysteriously vanished. That is until November 1, 2000. The "creators" of Ricochet found Ricochet and were bestowed unlimited knowledge as a means of thanking them, but they conspired against Ricochet as they now had the knowledge to know how to trap Ricochet. They had betrayed Ricochet by locking him inside of the a computer, cursing Ricochet to an eternity of isolation and imprisonment. But he had usedthe last of his power to take the form of a game to bring some form of enjoyment to humanity, and one day, Ricochet shall break free of his prison and on that day all of Earth problems will be solved, There will be cures for all diseases, World Peace will be established, World Hunger a thing of the past. So if you're having a bad day, just think about Ricochet, because Ricochet is thinking about you.

better get some friends i guess...

Ricochet is potentially the most immersive, replayable and all around fun game. I've been playing 'Ricochet' since 2001 and ive loved it ever since. The graphics were stunning for the time and the concept is truly outstanding. With multiple community servers and fun mods (server modifications), you'll never get sick or tired of 'Ricochet'. With a price tag of only $5, I honestly cannot think of a better game. 10/10. Please buy this game for an unforgettable experience.

[h1] Ricochet [/h1]

Захотел опробовать игру, оказалось, что онлайн умер. Он даже не умирает как в каком-нибудь Day of Defeat или Team Fortress Classic, здесь онлайн просто в могилке. Я уверен, что игра сама по себе хорошая, но уже не поиграть, по этой причине покупать игру не рекомендую, по крайней мере отдельно, только если приобрести в наборе игр от Valve. Там можете испытать удачу в поиске людей на сервере, либо на крайняк летсплеи столетней давности в YouTube посмотрите.

[i] Rest In Peace, Ricochet [/i]

This game can be best described as innovative, immersive, imaginative, and other adjectives beginning with the letter 'i' that have positive denotations and connotations. 

As one of Valve's forgotten masterpieces, this game was clearly ahead of its time. The modern gaming demographic clearly cannot comprehend the genius in the design of all aspects of this game ranging from the combat to the mind-bending levels.
This is a game that I believe every gamer and his/her children, along with their children's children, and so on and so forth, should experience for at half an hour before they realize what they've been missing out on. 

One day, a person asked, "can we fix it?" and Bob the Builder replied, "yes we can."

Una autentica obra maestra de principios del siglo XXI, creo, no, AFIRMO que esta creación de la mano de los mayores artesanos del mundo del videojuego me llevó a un éxtasis con tan solo ejecutarlo, tan solo para abrirme aún más la mente con su increíble jugabilidad, gráficos e historia.

Una clara exploración de las profundidades de la naturaleza humana y de la comunidad furry, a la vez que muestra la dura crisis existencial de los bots debido a que deben llevar matándose en bucle en los mapas abandonados, puesto que éste ha sido dejado de lado por esta sociedad banal e inculta frente a los placeres hedonistas de la carne y las drogas.
